summary: After 30 years advising on M&A in the energy and agri/chemicals industries, I am now General Counsel at GAFT where we are delivering sustainable solutions to reduce carbon in the aviation sector.

school.name: School of Law, University of Surrey

profile_positions.description: GAFT - Green Aviation Fuel Technologies – is developing the first end-to-end solution to renewable jet fuel out of CO2 without using fossil fuels or food crops.
profile_positions.title: General Counsel

profile_positions.description:
At Bouncebackability, I provide strategic advice to clients on M&A tranactions and investment structuring from a legal and organisational perspective. I lead negotiations and draft and review legal documents ranging from JVA to EPC contracts through to trade, finance and collaboration agreements and combine that with an advisory role to clients on new opportunities, development of projects, corporate governance and executing on strategy: this extends to considering new markets and strategic collaborations with other players in the relevant sector.

In the past 30 years I have advised on commercial transactions in most parts of the world. The principal area of focus was M&A and project development and the total value of deals was more than €300 billion, most of which were in the energy space and specifically oil, gas and power (thermal, hydro and nuclear) and mining. Clients included various Governments (including those of the Russian Federation, Kazakhstan, Saudi Arabia, Venezuela and Madagascar), the CEOs of State-owned companies and the Boards of many listed companies. The deals have ranged from M&A auction sales through to privatizations, restructuring of industries to complex pre-litigation, commodity financings to novel products including an NFT offering in South America as well as a variety of project developments such as: the first IPP in Russia, the rehabilitation of a Nigerian refinery complex, the construction of a road in Poland, a multi-modal transportation project in Colombia and the proposed siting of a power project in north Africa.
profile_positions.title: Executive Director

profile_positions.description:
As the Senior Vice President for Strategic Projects at 8 Rivers LLC (www.8rivers.com) I am responsible for devising and implementing the Group’s strategy for new market development and securing opportunities for the deployment of our suite of clean power technologies: CCUS, DACC, hydrogen and ammonia. An important part of this role is to lead various fund raise activities associated with project development and to work with the CEO and CFO as we seek external capital to progress the journey from large-scale technology incubator to global licensor and developer of clean fuel power projects.
In addition to the global role, I am the commercial lead for the development of the Whitetail and Crossbill net zero carbon projects in Teesside, UK which will require an aggregate capex in excess of £1 billion and will deliver more than 600MW of carbon free electrical power a year: equivalent to providing light to over 500,000 homes. On a regular basis, I work with the team interacting with Government (including the UK Department of Business Energy and Industrial Strategy), lead the commercial negotiations with our JV partners, work with our project contractors including the OE, FEED, EPC and OEM, engage with external advisers both to us as sponsor and to the project vehicle (including investment banks, external counsel, press and government relations advisers) and manage project delivery.
profile_positions.title: SVP Strategic Projects

profile_positions.description:
David Griston is a partner in the Corporate and M&A practice as well as the Energy group. He focuses on M&A in the natural resources and commodities sectors. He advises international and local oil companies and states on upstream matters including PSAs, technology suppliers and developers on new-build nuclear power plants and international commodity houses on investments in agribusiness assets and infrastructure, and mine-metals developments.

Based in Amsterdam, David's work involves a number of jurisdictions including those of Central and Eastern Europe, Central Asia, Africa and Western Europe.
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description:
Head of the Russian Energy Practice, Head of the Global Agribusiness Practice and co-Head of the Global Energy Team, I was based in Moscow and Amsterdam and worked on transactions throughout Europe, the UK, Africa and Asia. 

While at CC I worked on a large number of acquisitions and disposals and auction deals (such as the sale of a US listed company's entire European business to a PE house and its UK business to a turnaround specialist, the acquisition of a European oil terminal storage business, the sale of the entire international portfolio of a Spanish windfarm operator, and the sale of the Rotterdam refinery business), joint ventures (including a global arrangement between Siemens and Rosatom for deployment of nuclear power) and collaboration and co-operation arrangements. I have also worked extensively on corporate restructurings both pre- and post-acquisition and governance arrangements, and on various trade and project finance transactions.
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.location: London, Brussels Tashkent, Almaty and Moscow
profile_positions.description: From 2001 until 2006, I was the Head of the Moscow Office and from 2006 until 2007 the Head of Projects for Central and Eastern Europe. Prior to 2000, I was an associate and trainee at the firm and was based in London, Brussels, Tashkent, Almaty and Moscow. Throughout my time at CMS Cameron McKenna I focussed on a mix of M&A and finance transactions, many of them in the energy sector. Some of the more memorable deals included: the privatization of the Uzbek tobacco and telecoms industries and Aeroflot; the rehabilitation of the Uzen oil field, and the buy-in to the Kashagan oilfield consortium in Kazakhstan; advising Shell on the disposal of part of the Sakhalin 2 project to Gazprom; and the multi-billion joint venture for an aluminium/hydroelectric project in the Far East of Russia.
